I THOUGHT I MIGHT HAVE TO QUIT PLAYING GOLF, ETC. INSTEAD, I AM QUITTING THE NORVASC AND LOPRESSOR! column2: beagleguy48, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Been on Lopressor for more than two years now. Started at 100mg daily, now at 200mg daily. I also take Azor, although I have recently learned you shouldn't mix a beta blocker with a calcium channel blocker. I recently had to have two stents placed in heart artery because of 90 percent blockage in two locations in same artery. I have a slow heart rate, a little shortness of breath and periodic mild dizziness. Super blood pressure, consistantly in the 115-120 over 60-70 range. Resting heart rate is in upper 50s to lower 60s. The only real complaint I have is that when I exercise, it's difficult if not impossible to get my heart rate up, which of course, creates an oxygenation problem. Tire easily. Will be talking to cardiologist today about this problem.

column2: delevy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: the only thing i do not like about the meds is the side effects, but im glad to have a normal heart again.

column2: David, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After reading through all the reviews I thought, wow! I am Type II Diabetic and this drug is the best High Blood Pressure medicine for Diabetics because it doesn't raise the blood sugar levels.I am like the girl with the super high BP and my normal was around 190/140 or higher.I was first on 50mg twice daily. That got me down to 140/90 for a low. Then recently the doctor increased me to 100mg twice daily. Bingo!I am now in the normal range and have seen 111/63. But my Heart Rate is still in the mid to high 80's.Added to this problem is that I have to take huge doses of Potassium to combat the potassium stripping the Lasix does.And I am on high dose of Lasix, 160mg once a day and 18,000mg Potassium (18k is not a miss-print) Plus that isn't enough to get rid of the fluid, so have to take Zaroxolyn too. I have Meniere's disease, both ears. The Glands that control the fluid in the body is dead on me. So, I have zero fluid control. So, reducing the edema (fluids) wasn't enough, and Lopressor works well for me. As for Sex drive, Oh I have no problem there! I have all the want and desire!  :-)

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Influenza caused pericarditis & damaged my heart valve & left me with Mitral Valve Prolapse & PVCs in lower right ventricle.  I couldnt even walk across a room, was so breathless.  Irregular heartbeats were exhausting me & making me faint.  This drug helped immensely & Ive taken it gratefully for 17 years now. Some generics dont work as well, some do. Mitral valve works much better now.

column2: historyfreak03, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Has worked great keeping my heart rate and rhythm normal.

column2: spamlamb, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started out with a bp of about 250/190.  Yikes, right?  Especially for someone my age, which is 30.  I was prescribed Lopressor two weeks ago and today my pressure was 140/92.  Not perfect yet, I know, but wow!  Furthermore, I used to have serious headaches that I attributed to migraine but I haven't had the first one since I started this medication.  I have to say, I'm really pleased with my results.
